required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Life Among Hungarian Women With Urinary Incontinence
clinical_study.official_title: Health-related Quality of Life Among Hungarian Women With Urinary Incontinence

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to assess the prevalence of urinary incontinence among Hungarian women. In addition to that, we aim evaluate the health related quality of life among Hungarian women with urinary incontinence and to culturally adapt the following questionnaires for the Hungarian population: Incontinence Impact Questionnaire - Short Form (IIQ-7) and King's Health Questionnaire (KHQ).

primary_outcome.measure: International Consultation of Incontinence Questionnaire - Short Form
primary_outcome.description: The International Consultation of Incontinence Questionnaire - Short Form (ICIQ-SF) will be used to gather information about the symptoms of urinary incontinence. It contains six questions. The total score can range from 0 to 21, with higher scores suggesting more severe symptoms.

The King's Health Questionnaire (KHQ) will be used to measure the impact of urinary incontinence on the subject's health related quality of life. It assesses quality of life in nine different domains of life. Each domain is scored separately ranging from 0 (best) to 100 (worst).

The Incontinence Impact Questionnaire short form (IIQ-7) will be also used to measure the impact of urinary incontinence on the subject's health related quality of life. It is comprised of seven questions. The total score ranges from 0 to 21, with higher scores indicating more severe symptoms and worse quality of life.

secondary_outcome.description: The Short-Form-36 (SF-36) will be used to measure the generic health-related quality of life of participants. It consists of 35 individual questions and it is divided into eight domains of health. The total score ranges from 0 (worst health state) to 100 (best health state).

study_pop.textblock: Women aged 18 years or older who are able to read and write Hungarian.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Woman
- Age 18 and above
- Providing consent to participate
- Ability to read and write Hungarian
Exclusion Criteria:
- Respondents who are unable to complete the online survey due to illiteracy
- Man
